servinfo.title: Camshaft and Tappet Removal and Installation

s1.ptxt: Remove engine assembly referring to Engine Assembly Removal and Installation:F9Q .
Remove timing belt referring to Timing Belt and Belt Tensioner Removal and Installation:F9Q .
Remove injection pump and front bracket referring to Injection Pump Removal and Installation:F9Q .
Remove vacuum pump referring to Vacuum Pump Removal and Installation:F9Q .
Remove CMP sensor referring to Camshaft Position (CMP) Sensor Removal and Installation:F9Q .
Remove camshaft pulley as follows.

s2.ptxt: Fix camshaft pulley using special tool.
Loosen camshaft pulley bolt (1), and remove camshaft pulley (2).

s1.ptxt: Remove cylinder head cover referring to Cylinder Head Cover Removal and Installation:F9Q .
Loosen camshaft housing bolts evenly and gradually in numerical order “1” through “10” as shown in figure, and remove them.
Remove camshaft housing and camshaft from cylinder head.
Remove camshaft oil seal from camshaft.
Remove tappet (1) from cylinder head.

attention2.ptxt: Note original position in which each tappet was installed when valve lash (clearance) adjustment is not necessary.
If each tappet is not installed to original position, engine will spoil its original performance.

s1.ptxt: Apply engine oil around tappet (1), and then install it to cylinder head.
Install camshaft to cylinder head as follows.

s2.ptxt: Apply engine oil to sliding surface of each camshaft and camshaft journal.
Fit timing belt inner cover (1), and tighten timing belt inner cover bolts (2) after applying “A” to bolt thread.
Install camshaft pulley (2) to camshaft (4) aligning key (1) to groove (3).
Tighten camshaft pulley bolt temporarily by hand.
Turn camshaft pulley clockwise, and stop turning crankshaft immediately before mark (1) of camshaft pulley (2) with mark (3) of timing belt inner cover (4).
Install camshaft housing to cylinder head as follows.

s3.ptxt: Remove oil, old sealant and dust from sealing surfaces of camshaft housing (1) and cylinder head cover.
Apply sealant “A” to sealing surface area of camshaft housing (1) using stipple roller (2) as shown in figure.
Fit camshaft holder to cylinder head.
Apply “A” to camshaft housing bolt thread.
Tighten camshaft housing bolts evenly and gradually in numerical order (“1” through “10”) by repeating tightening sequence two or three times until specified torque is obtained.

torqueitem.t-note: Tighten 20 N·m (2.0 kgf-m, 14.5 lbf-ft) by the specified procedure

s1.ptxt: Remove camshaft pulley.
Install camshaft oil seal as follows.

s2.ptxt: Install oil seal to camshaft by tightening bolt (2) of special tool until installer (3) of special tool comes contact with cylinder head.

s1.ptxt: Install camshaft pulley (2) to camshaft (4) aligning key (1) to groove (3).
Tighten camshaft pulley bolt (1) to specified torque using special tool.
Install CMP sensor referring to Camshaft Position (CMP) Sensor Removal and Installation:F9Q .
Install vacuum pump referring to Vacuum Pump Removal and Installation:F9Q .
Install injection pump and front bracket referring to Injection Pump Removal and Installation:F9Q .
Install timing belt referring to Timing Belt and Belt Tensioner Removal and Installation:F9Q .
Check valve lash (clearance) referring to Valve Lash (Clearance) Inspection:F9Q .
Install cylinder head cover referring to Cylinder Head Cover Removal and Installation:F9Q
Install engine assembly referring to Engine Assembly Removal and Installation:F9Q .
